rev.comment: /* Developing legal issues */ and the sun rose because my ararm went off. succession does not prove cause. the stock market dropped worldwide

===Developing legal issues===
===Developing legal issues===
â
On Wednesday, January 18, 2006, the U.S. Justice Department filed a [[motion to compel]] in U.S. District Court in San Jose seeking a court order that would compel search engine company Google, Inc. to turn over "a multi-stage random sample of one million URLâs" from Googleâs database, and a computer file with "the text of each search string entered onto Googleâs search engine over a one-week period (absent any information identifying the person who entered such query)." As a result of this developing news, Google's stock plunged on January 20, 2006, causing the stock to suffer its largest one day point (-$36.98) and percentage drop (-8.47%) since it went public, closing at $399.46 [[U.S.]] on the [[Nasdaq]]. Over $11 [[billion]] was slashed from the market cap of Google as a result.
+
On Wednesday, January 18, 2006, the U.S. Justice Department filed a [[motion to compel]] in U.S. District Court in San Jose seeking a court order that would compel search engine company Google, Inc. to turn over "a multi-stage random sample of one million URLâs" from Googleâs database, and a computer file with "the text of each search string entered onto Googleâs search engine over a one-week period (absent any information identifying the person who entered such query)."
The text of the motion is accessible at [http://news.findlaw.com/hdocs/docs/google/gonzgoog11806m.html FindLaw]
